intro: Brazzeia congoensis, commonly known as the Congo brazzeia, is a climbing plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Its fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds. Brazzeia congoensis is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
